articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Wednesday's papers focus on the Princess of Wales entering cancer remission and Tulip Siddiq's resignation.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: Kate's 'relief to be in remission' and 'Siddiq quits'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The BBC's political editor explains the headaches the Treasury is giving Sir Keir Starmer.
articles.title: Chris Mason: Political heat map flashes red over Treasury

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: There is a risk too many people are being diagnosed as obese, with weight-loss drugs in high demand.
articles.title: Global report urges more accurate definition of obesity than BMI

articles.description: It comes after growing pressure over an anti-corruption investigation in Bangladesh.
articles.title: Tulip Siddiq resigns as Treasury minister

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The world-famous street artist taught art lessons with local children in the 1990s.
articles.title: 'I hired Banksy for £50 then painted over his mural'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The UK led the way in this field of science until recently - but now other countries have overtaken. So, how can that lead be recovered?
articles.title: Fatbergs turned into perfume: Britain's new industrial revolution

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: MPs vote for a cap on advanced rent payments in England as the Renters' Rights Bill edges closer to becoming law.
articles.title: MPs back one-month cap on advance rent payments

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Former Sinn Fein president Gerry Adams is in line for "a pay day from the taxpayer" under plans to repeal the Legacy Act, a report backed by several peers has stated.
articles.title: Gerry Adams could be in line for "a pay day from the taxpayer", says report.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A report finds the special educational needs and disabilities system in "disarray" and lacking funds.
articles.title: Fix Send now or risk a 'lost generation' of children, MPs warn

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The area in Gaza which Israel's military has told people to go to "for their safety" has been hit by 97 strikes since May, BBC Verify analysis has revealed.
articles.title: Almost 100 strikes in Gaza 'humanitarian zone', BBC Verify finds
